title: Ukraine rips Elon Musk for disrupting sneak attack on Russian fleet with Starlink cutoff
description: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk ordered engineers to shut off his Starlink network's internet over Crimea in order to thwart a Ukrainian attack on Russia's fleet.

title: Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon sees Wall Street rebound if tech IPOs perform
description: Capital markets could get a boost from upcoming tech IPOs, such as Arm and Instacart, Solomon told CNBC.

title: What to do if your flight gets canceled: 'Use every tool in the toolbox,' says travel expert
description: AirHelp and The Points Guy explain to CNBC Make It the best steps to take if your flight is canceled or delayed.

title: Disney drops all but free speech claim in political retaliation suit against DeSantis
description: Disney last week had asked to drop its other claims in the federal case because they are being actively pursued in a separate state-level lawsuit in Florida.

title: Former FTX exec Salame to forfeit $1.5 billion, pleads guilty to two criminal counts
Former Trump aide Peter Navarro guilty of two counts of contempt of Congress
description: Peter Navarro has said he failed to comply with a subpoena from Congress because former President Donald Trump told him to assert executive privilege.

title: Carl Icahn says new Illumina CEO has his 'full support' months after proxy fight
description: Activist investor Icahn's blessing is a relief for the company as it tries to rebound from a bitter proxy fight with the billionaire investor.

title: UAW president calls GM offer with 10% pay increases ‘insulting’ ahead of strike deadline a week away
description: GM's latest offer still falls short of the union's demands. The UAW could strike against all three Detroit automakers next week.

title: Apple shares fall after reports that China banned iPhone use by government employees
description: The reported restrictions, which have not been publicly announced by the Chinese government, raise concerns that Apple's products could get caught up in international tensions between the U.S. and China.

title: British American Tobacco finalizes Russia exit with sale to local managers
description: British American Tobacco's brands include Camel and Newport.

title: New York man was killed 'instantly' by Peloton bike, his family says in lawsuit
description: The family of Ryan Furtado claims his Peloton bike severed his carotid artery and killed him "instantly," marking the first known death linked to the bike.

title: Stripe rival Adyen secures banking license in the UK
description: Adyen has acquired a banking license in the U.K., which enables its merchants to offer cash advances to small and medium-sized enterprises in the country.

title: Biden heads to New Delhi for G20 amid rising global tensions
description: President Joe Biden will travel to New Delhi to meet with the world's largest economies at the Group of 20 summit.

title: Brits are the least likely to say work is important to their lives — and the U.S. isn't far behind
description: A new survey from King's College London has found Brits and Americans are among those who are least likely to say work is an important part of their lives.

title: 68-year-old who 'unretired': I went on a 30-day silent retreat—what I learned about how to live a happy, regret-free life
description: George Jerjian is an author and business owner who unretired in his early 60s. He shares the valuable lessons about happiness he learned from a life-changing silent retreat.

title: Tiny ‘bubble cars’ from the 1960s are making a comeback. Take a look at the latest electric versions
description: The potential need for a small electric car appears to be gaining traction, as the demand for cleaner vehicles in urban environments grows.

title: EU's crackdown on Apple, Meta and others is to avoid forced breakups, top official says
description: Big Tech is facing tighter scrutiny in the European Union, but officials want to avoid forcing them to break up parts of the business.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Input prices are going up
description: The roaring flames of 9.1% inflation in June last year have been quenched, but the last few glowing embers are proving hard to extinguish completely.

title: Blockbuster weight loss drugs Wegovy and Ozempic are being tested to treat addiction and dementia
description: Scientists have begun investigating whether so-called miracle obesity drugs can be used to help treat conditions such as dementia and alcohol addiction.

title: Can stocks finish strong in 2023? Wall Street giants weigh in
description: Stock markets are coming off a rough month on soaring bond yields and concerns about China's economy, but strategists with some of Wall Street's biggest banks are cautiously optimistic.

title: China's exports drop by 8.8% in August as trade slump persists
description: China's economic rebound from the pandemic has slowed in the last few months, dragged down by a property market slump and lackluster consumer spending.

title: Wall, what wall? Two detained after leveling part of China's Great Wall
description: In an apparent attempt to create a shortcut, two people working in Shanxi province allegedly used machinery to remove a section of the Great Wall of China.

title: Tencent releases AI model for businesses as competition in China heats up
description: Dowson Tong, CEO of the cloud and smart industries group at Tencent, spoke with CNBC's Emily Tan in an exclusive interview ahead of a big AI reveal.

title: India's consumer market set to become the world's third largest by 2027, behind the U.S. and China
description: Growth in India's household spending per capita is expected to outpace that of other developing Asian economies like Indonesia, the Philippines and Thailand.

title: U.S. electric carmaker Lucid is exploring China entry; confirms mass market models ahead
description: Lucid is exploring selling its cars in China but has no timeline for when it will enter the world's largest electric car market, a top executive told CNBC.
